data.embedded: Recording Info

data.script:
const flags2labels = (labels, flags) => labels.filter( (l, index) => flags[index])


window.$data =     {
 "Workflow Stage": "Audio Data Labeling",
 "read only": false,
 "FINALIZED": false,
 "Segmented Heart Sound": true,
 "Segmented Lung Sound": true,
 "Segmented Intestinal Sound": true,
 "Final Heart Sound Review Completed": true,
 "Final Lung Sound Review Completed": true,
 "Final Vascular Sound Review Completed": "No",
 "Intestinal Sounds Review Completed": true,
 "Clinical Metadata Reviewed": true,
 "Heart sound is present": true,
 "Lung sound is present": true,
 "Periferal vascular sound is present": true,
 "Bowel sound is present": true,
 "Recording quality": "Best",
 "Class of the informativeness": "Informative",
 "Type of artifacts , Artifact": "External noise, Electrical interference, Clipping",
 "Examination ID": "AVT0005",
 "Patient Count": 1,
 "Age (Years)": 60,
 "Gender": "Male",
 "Ethnicity": "White",
 "Body Position": "supine",
 "Body Spot": "tricuspid",
 "Stethoscope Model": "http://ec2-54-235-192-121.compute-1.amazonaws.com:8002/?record_v2=OfbD7tnVbDg9mMIoxADKPXHbvkX2%2Frecordings%2FeKuore_s15kcCEiwggKESmjj1BK&patientId=AVT0005&position=supine&spot=tricuspid&device=eKuore",
 "model": "eKuore",
 "path": "OfbD7tnVbDg9mMIoxADKPXHbvkX2%2Frecordings%2FeKuore_s15kcCEiwggKESmjj1BK",
 "Recorded with Fiter": "Raw",
 "Healthy": false,
 "S1 Loudness": "Loud",
 "S1 Split Type": "Normal",
 "S1 Description": "Loud Unidentified",
 "S2 Split Type": "Unclassifiable",
 "S2 description": "Normal loudness",
 "S3": false,
 "S3 Type": "Pathological",
 "S4": false,
 "Ejection Sound": true,
 "Systolic Murmur Unspicified": true,
 "Systolic Murmur": true,
 "Mid Systolic Murmur": true,
 "Still's Murmur": true,
 "Holosystolic Murmur": true,
 "Ejection Type Murmur": true,
 "Late Systolic Murmur": true,
 "Diastolic Murmur": true,
 "Diastolic High Frequency Murmur": true,
 "Austin Flint murmur": true,
 "Diastolic Low Frequency Murmur": true,
 "Additional Systolic Tones": true,
 "Additional Diastolic Tones": true,
 "Pericardial Friction Rub": true,
 "Pericardial Knock": true,
 "Constant Murmur": true,
 "Arterial murmur": "Long",
 "Respiratory Sound Type": "Lung sound",
 "Stridor": false,
 "Wheeze": false,
 "Rhonchus": false,
 "Fine crackle": false,
 "Coarse crackle": false,
 "Pleural friction rub": false,
 "Squawk": false,
 "Clinical Diagnosis": "",
 "EKG Diagnosis": "",
 "Echo Diagnosis": "",
 "Comments": "",
 "form_id": "1swFthoFNCNmJd0cNl3Ej_MVKwdexQ9cG88tizVDa9uA"
}



window.$data.$enums = {"Final Vascular Sound Review Completed":["Yes","No","N/A"],"Recording quality":["Best","Good","Bad","Extremely bad"],"Class of the informativeness":["Informative","Decreased informative","Uninformative"],"Artifact":["External noise","Talking","Electrical interference","Muscle rumble","Contact with hair","Bad contact","Clipping","Movement","Low-cut filtering","Corrupted file"],"S1 Loudness":["Normal","Loud","Faint","Absent","Varying intensity"],"S1 Split Type":["Normal","Wide","Inverse","Unknown"],"S1 Description":["Loud tricuspid component","Loud Mitral Component","Mechanical prosthetic valve sound","Loud Unidentified"],"S2 Split Type":["Normal","Wide","Fixed","Paradixical","Unclassifiable","Absent"],"S2 description":["Normal loudness","Alternating","Loud aortic component","Loud pulmonic component","Loud both components","Loud","Soft","Absent","Mechanical prosthetic valve sound"],"S3 Type":["Pathological","Innocent","Unclassifiable"],"Arterial murmur":["Absent","Short","Long","Constant"],"Respiratory Sound Type":["Tracheal sound","Lung sound","Bronchial breathing"],"Sound Type":["Heart sound is present","Lung sound is present","Periferal vascular sound is present","Bowel sound is present"],"Murmurs":["Systolic Murmur Unspicified","Still's Murmur","Holosystolic Murmur","Ejection Type Murmur","Late Systolic Murmur","Mid Systolic Murmur","Diastolic Murmur","Diastolic Low Frequency Murmur","Austin Flint murmur","Diastolic High Frequency Murmur","Constant Murmur"],"Lung Pathologycal Sound":["Stridor","Wheeze","Rhonchus","Fine crackle","Coarse crackle","Pleural friction rub","Squawk"],"Segmentation Details features":["Segmented Heart Sound","Segmented Lung Sound","Segmented Intestinal Sound","Final Heart Sound Review Completed","Final Lung Sound Review Completed","Intestinal Sounds Review Completed","Clinical Metadata Reviewed"],"Pathological findings":["Arrhythmia (extrasystoles and atrial fibrillation)","Ejection Sound","Additional Systolic Tones","Additional Diastolic Tones","Pericardial Knock","Pericardial Friction Rub"]}

window.$data.$enums['S3 Presentation'] = ["Sound S3 is present"]
window.$data.$enums['S4 Presentation'] = ["Sound S4 is present"]

window.$data.soundPresentation = flags2labels(
            window.$data.$enums["Sound Type"],
            window.$data.$enums["Sound Type"]
    )
    
window.$data.Artifact = window.$data["Type of artifacts , Artifact"].split(",").map( d => d.trim())    

window.$data['S3 Presentation'] = (window.$data.S3) ? "Sound S3 is present" : null

window.$data['S4 Presentation'] = (window.$data.S4) ? "Sound S4 is present" : null

window.$data.murmurs = flags2labels(
            window.$data.$enums["Murmurs"],
            window.$data.$enums["Murmurs"]
    )
    
window.$data["Pathological findings"] = flags2labels(
            window.$data.$enums["Pathological findings"],
            window.$data.$enums["Pathological findings"]
    )

// console.log(window.$data.$enums["Lung Pathologycal Sound"])

window.$data["Lung Pathologycal Sound"] = flags2labels(
            window.$data.$enums["Lung Pathologycal Sound"],
            window.$data.$enums["Lung Pathologycal Sound"]
    )
    
window.$data["Segmentation Details features"] = flags2labels(
            window.$data.$enums["Segmentation Details features"],
            window.$data.$enums["Segmentation Details features"]
    )

data.embedded: Recording Validation
Heart Sounds
Heart Murmurs
Pathological findings

Lung Sounds
These may be either coarse or fine. They are discontinuous, interrupted explosive sounds. Coarse crackles or crepitations are associated with bronchiectasis or resolving pneumonia, whereas fine crackles can be heard with either pulmonary oedema or interstitial fibrosis.
Data Summary

data.value: ${`You can analyze the audio recording with this tool`}
